title: Nvidia reports earnings after the bell
content: Nvidia reports second fiscal-quarter earnings Wednesday after the bell.
summary: Nvidia reports second fiscal-quarter earnings Wednesday after the bell.

title: Libya’s power divisions could once more fracture its oil output – as markets question for how long
content: A tussle over the Libyan central bank's leadership has led the country's eastern administration to declare the shutdown of key oilfields.
summary: A tussle over the Libyan central bank's leadership has led the country's eastern administration to declare the shutdown of key oilfields.

title: Nokia brand owner launches Barbie phone for $130 — with no internet
content: HMD, the company behind Nokia-branded phones, launched a Barbie-branded phone Wednesday that comes with calls and texts — but no internet.
summary: HMD, the company behind Nokia-branded phones, launched a Barbie-branded phone Wednesday that comes with calls and texts — but no internet.

title: Google to relaunch tool for creating AI-generated images of people after pulling service due to inaccuracies
content: Google's Imagen 3 will allow Gemini users to create AI photos of people in the coming days.
summary: Google's Imagen 3 will allow Gemini users to create AI photos of people in the coming days.

title: Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway hits $1 trillion market value, first U.S. company outside of tech to do so
content: The milestone came two days before Buffett's 94th birthday.
summary: The milestone came two days before Buffett's 94th birthday.

title: Super Micro shares fall 23% on filing delay, Hindenburg Research report
content: Shares of Super Micro fell after the company announced it will not file its annual report for the fiscal year on time.
summary: Shares of Super Micro fell after the company announced it will not file its annual report for the fiscal year on time.

title: This high-income region has the least active people globally, WHO report shows
content: About 1.8 billion people did not meet their recommended levels of physical activity in 2022, according to a report by the World Health Organization.
summary: About 1.8 billion people did not meet their recommended levels of physical activity in 2022, according to a report by the World Health Organization.

title: You have a right to ignore your bosses — but only in these countries, and after work hours
content: Australia has joined the list of countries that allow employees the "right to disconnect" from work.
summary: Australia has joined the list of countries that allow employees the "right to disconnect" from work.

title: Goldman issues warning on how quickly market confidence has recovered from an August stocks slump
content: The speedy return of market confidence following a global sell-off in risky assets should be seen as a cause for concern, according to Goldman Sachs.
summary: The speedy return of market confidence following a global sell-off in risky assets should be seen as a cause for concern, according to Goldman Sachs.

title: OpenSea receives Wells notice from SEC, regulator says NFTs are securities
content: Crypto marketplace OpenSea has been added to the SEC's list of targets, as the regulator extends its crackdown on the sector.
summary: Crypto marketplace OpenSea has been added to the SEC's list of targets, as the regulator extends its crackdown on the sector.

title: U.S. government researchers visit a Korean mine as the race against China for critical minerals heats up
content: The Sangdong Mine, owned by a subsidiary of Canada-based Almonty Industries, is set to resume operations this year.
summary: The Sangdong Mine, owned by a subsidiary of Canada-based Almonty Industries, is set to resume operations this year.

title: Shares of Abercrombie & Fitch plunge 15% after CEO warns of 'increasingly uncertain environment'
content: Abercrombie & Fitch has become one of Wall Street's biggest retail winners and the company plans to keep up the growth by expanding into international markets.
summary: Abercrombie & Fitch has become one of Wall Street's biggest retail winners and the company plans to keep up the growth by expanding into international markets.

title: UK's Starmer, Germany's Scholz seek to strengthen ties in post-Brexit reset
content: U.K. Prime Minister Keir Starmer and German Chancellor Olaf Scholz met in Berlin on Wednesday for discussions about a bilateral agreement.
summary: U.K. Prime Minister Keir Starmer and German Chancellor Olaf Scholz met in Berlin on Wednesday for discussions about a bilateral agreement.

title: Lego revenue jumps 13% in first half of 2024, boosted by Lego Fortnite and diverse brick sets
content: Lego said revenue during the first six months of the year jumped 13%, reaching 31 billion Danish krone, or about $4.65 billion.
summary: Lego said revenue during the first six months of the year jumped 13%, reaching 31 billion Danish krone, or about $4.65 billion.

title: Chinese EV company Xpeng sees shares pop 6% after it launches mass-market car
content: Xpeng shares rose after the Chinese electric car company said prices for its new mass-market Mona brand would start as low as $16,812, far below that of Tesla.
summary: Xpeng shares rose after the Chinese electric car company said prices for its new mass-market Mona brand would start as low as $16,812, far below that of Tesla.

title: Foot Locker shares drop 12% despite first comparable sales growth in six quarters
content: Foot Locker has spent two years transforming its business, and it's now seeing sales and margins expand, indicating its efforts are finally starting to work.
summary: Foot Locker has spent two years transforming its business, and it's now seeing sales and margins expand, indicating its efforts are finally starting to work.

title: China’s state media: Canada is 'shooting itself in the foot’ with new EV tariffs
content: On Monday, Canada announced that it would import 100% tariffs on China-made electric vehicles, effective Oct. 1.
summary: On Monday, Canada announced that it would import 100% tariffs on China-made electric vehicles, effective Oct. 1.

title: Nvidia has become world's 'most important stock,' adding pressure to upcoming earnings report
content: Nvidia has been the primary beneficiary of the AI boom, as a handful of the richest technology companies order billions of dollars of the company's processors.
summary: Nvidia has been the primary beneficiary of the AI boom, as a handful of the richest technology companies order billions of dollars of the company's processors.

title: China's Nongfu Spring sees shares fall over 12% as beverage maker's profit growth slows
content: Shares of China's largest bottled water producer Nongfu Spring slumped after posting a sharp slowdown in its half-year profit growth.
summary: Shares of China's largest bottled water producer Nongfu Spring slumped after posting a sharp slowdown in its half-year profit growth.

title: JD.com shares climb after announcing $5 billion share buyback, outperforming decline in Hang Seng
content: The announcement is JD.com's second buyback this year, after announcing a $3 billion buyback in March.
summary: The announcement is JD.com's second buyback this year, after announcing a $3 billion buyback in March.

title: Bitcoin falls for a fourth day, dipping below $60,000, as investors brace for Nvidia earnings
content: Cryptocurrencies extended losses on Wednesday following a jump in liquidations and as investors braced for Nvidia earnings.

title: Volkswagen China is spending lots of time at Xpeng to make new EVs
content: German auto giant Volkswagen is spending more time at Xpeng than the other way around, Xpeng co-president Brian Gu told CNBC on Monday.
summary: German auto giant Volkswagen is spending more time at Xpeng than the other way around, Xpeng co-president Brian Gu told CNBC on Monday.

title: Copper prices near six-week high as one strategist says the 'worst of the correction is over'
content: Copper prices on Tuesday rose to a near six-week high, supported by fresh demand and optimism over the potential for imminent U.S. interest rate cuts.
summary: Copper prices on Tuesday rose to a near six-week high, supported by fresh demand and optimism over the potential for imminent U.S. interest rate cuts.

title: Mark Zuckerberg says White House 'pressured' Meta to 'censor' Covid-19 content
content: Zuckerberg said it was ultimately Meta's decision to take down any content, but he noted he believes that the alleged "government pressure was wrong."
summary: Zuckerberg said it was ultimately Meta's decision to take down any content, but he noted he believes that the alleged "government pressure was wrong."

title: Trump budget would spike deficits by nearly 5 times Harris proposal, says Penn Wharton
content: Donald Trump and Kamala Harris have both received criticism from economists on their policy proposals so far.

title: Eli Lilly releases new form of weight loss drug Zepbound for half the price to boost access, supply
content: Eli Lilly is offering 2.5-milligram and 5-milligram single-dose vials of Zepbound for $399 per month and $549 per month, respectively.
summary: Eli Lilly is offering 2.5-milligram and 5-milligram single-dose vials of Zepbound for $399 per month and $549 per month, respectively.

title: Trump re-charged in special counsel election case due to Supreme Court immunity ruling
content: Donald Trump is still charged with four counts related to his alleged efforts to illegally overturn his loss to President Joe Biden in the 2020 election.
summary: Donald Trump is still charged with four counts related to his alleged efforts to illegally overturn his loss to President Joe Biden in the 2020 election.

title: Who is Telegram founder Pavel Durov — and why was he arrested?
content: The Paris Public Prosecutor's Office issued an arrest warrant for Durov in connection to an investigation opened on July 8.
